cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River, or 145 miles southeast of Houma, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the north-central Gulf toward southeastern Louisiana, then forecast to slow and move north over Louisiana and western Mississippi before turning northeast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near Port Fourchon–Buras area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward into Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds likely, potentially 100–140 mph with catastrophic wind damage near the core.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge of 8–12 ft possible at and east of the mouth of the Mississippi River, with risk of levee overtopping.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–18 inches with isolated amounts to 24 inches producing life-threatening flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, large dangerous waves, rip currents, and prolonged loss of power.
